description.narrative: The objectives of the Project are to improve forest fire prevention and suppression in select forest ecosystems, including targetedprotected areas, and to enhance forest management in pilot regions.

condition.narrative: Finance Agreement :Section IA4(a) of Schedule 2 | Description :The Borrower shall enter into an Agency Agreement with MNRE and thePIU, on terms and conditions satisfactory to the Bank, for provision of day-to-day support for implementation. | Frequency :Monthly

Finance Agreement :Section IA4(b) of Schedule 2 | Description :The Borrower shall enter into an Agency Agreement with FFA and thePIU, on terms and conditions satisfactory to the Bank, for provision of day-to-day support for implementation. | Frequency :Monthly

Finance Agreement :Section IA4(c) of Schedule 2 | Description :The Borrower shall perform its obligations under the AgencyAgreements and cause the PIU to perform its obligations under the Agency Agreements. | Frequency :Monthly

Finance Agreement :Section IB1 of Schedule 2 | Description :Borrower shall prepare and disclose, prior to commencing any works,site-specific EMPs; carry out site-specific EMPs in accordance with the EMP; and shall not amend the EMPs without Bank approval. |Frequency :Monthly

Finance Agreement :Section IB2 of Schedule 2 | Description :Borrower shall prepare and disclose an IPP when required by the IPPF;carry out the IPP in accordance with the IPPF; and shall not amend any of the provisions of the IPP without Bank approval. |Frequency :Monthly

title.narrative: Forest information management systems in operation, with data generated by Protected Areas used to produce reporting on forest firerisks, hazards, response, and damage
Area covered by improved Forest Pest Monitoring System in Pilot Regions
Protected Area fire brigades equipped and trained
Landscape restoration programs developed in disturbed PA landscapes
Area of improved forest regeneration based on modern technology in Pilot Regions
Updated fire danger rating and hazard index system trialed in targeted Protected Areas
Number of PAs covered by fire management planning and implementation to protect biodiversity and habitat
Average area of fires at detection in project PAs
Increase in percentage of fires contained within 24 hours following detection in project PAs
Increase in percentage of fires contained within 24 hours following detection in pilot region extensive forest
Proportion of large fires out of the total number of fires in Pilot Regions exentsive forest
Reach and acceptance of fire prevention messages among the PA target population in comparison to baseline
Reforms in forest policy, legislation or other regulations supported
Increase in percentage of fires contained within 24 hours following detection in pilot region extensive forest and project PAs
Decrease in the number of fires in Project PAs in comparison to comparable PAs without project support
Development of a National Forest Fire Management Strategy for Federal PAs
